#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Dress Like a Crusty
#Text=A Crusty is punk 's most extreme offshoot .
#Text=This article will show you how to dress like one !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Buy yourself some appropriate footwear .
#Text=Salvaged or second hand converse trainers or plimsolls are good , but combat boots are better .
#Text=Get some black stretch jeans or black work pants from a second-hand store .
#Text=Alternatively you could get camouflage trousers ( or shorts for the summer ) from an army surplus store .
#Text=If you want to be really crusty , you could just sew your own trousers from scratch using cheaply bought or found fabric .
#Text=Customize .
#Text=Screen print some political or crust band patches using white fabric paint .
#Text=Then sew these onto your trousers with white dental floss .
#Text=You can also sew plain black patches onto your trousers .
#Text=Try to totally cover your trousers in patches .
#Text=Do n't worry if they overlap , this looks very crusty .
#Text=You can also sew purposeless zippers onto your trousers .
#Text=Plain patches made out of camouflage , leopard print or vegan friendly false leather are also cool .
#Text=Attaching studs or flattened lighter heads onto the tops of your pockets is a nice touch .
#Text=Butt flaps are a very cool crusty accessory .

#Text=This is a roughly square patches of fabric that you can attach to the front of your pants ( in which case you can sew it so it functions like a pocket ) or the back of them ( in which case it stops your but getting cold when you sit down and it stops the butt of your pants wearing through ) .
#Text=Either way , painting or patching DIY silk screened band names or political slogans or symbols on your butt flap is very crusty .
#Text=Choose or make your belts .
#Text=When it comes to belts you 've got two options : Either a length of rope or a bullet belt .
#Text=Do n't be afraid to use both !
#Text=Buy black t-shirts from a charity store or army surplus store .

#Text=Then paint political designs or crust band names/logos ( which are often going to be politically charged anyway ) on them with white fabric paint ( use a home made stencil for extra precision ) .
#Text=If you do n't want to risk messing up your t-shirt you could just screen print a large patch and then sew this onto your t-shirt .
#Text=Cutting the sleeves and collar off your t-shirt is very crust .
#Text=You can then re-cycle this fabric to make patches .
#Text=Buy a black hooded sweatshirt from a second hand store .
#Text=Customize it like your pants .
#Text=Attach studs and flattened lighter heads onto the hood rim .
#Text=Sew home made patches all over it and sew a big back patch onto the back .
#Text=Remember to use white dental floss .
#Text=If it 's a pullover hooded sweatshirt , you could try painting a crust band or political statement onto the front of yours .
#Text=Try finding a black denim jacket .
#Text=Customize it in the same way as your trousers except this time you can cover it in metal studs or spikes .
#Text=Putting these on over the plain patches looks very good .
#Text=Try sewing on a home made back patch with your handy dental floss .
#Text=You could try splattering your jacket with bleach before you start customizing it for a very crusty effect .
#Text=Attaching political/band buttons onto the front of your jacket is cool .
#Text=Even better if you buy a badge making machine and make them yourself
#Text=Alternatively , you could buy an army jacket from a charity store or an army surplus store .
#Text=Customize it by adding patches and lengths of chain .
#Text=Buy a black baseball or trucker hat from a charity store , or a black army cap from an army surplus store .
#Text=Sew home made patches onto it or paint stuff directly onto it !
#Text=You can also try embedding spikes onto the bill .
#Text=Own some basic accessories .
#Text=Jewelry made out of hemp or found materials is very crusty .
#Text=Lengths of chain attached with a carabiner or padlock are also cool .
#Text=A black bandanna would top off your look , so long as you get it from a charity store .
#Text=Try to avoid using hair dye or hair products .
#Text=Just let it grow long and become naturally matted and unkempt .
#Text=It may dreadlock on its own or you may opt to dreadlock it yourself .
#Text=You could also shave sections of your hair to get a dreadhawk or a dreadlet .
#Text=Body modifications .
#Text=DIY tattoos and piercings are a good idea .
#Text=But remember to take care of them and avoid infection .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Make sure you 're actually a member of the political organization whose button you 're wearing , or that you like the band whose patch you 're wearing .
#Text=The DIY look is an expression of anti-capitalism .
#Text=If you ca n't make something or buy it from a charity/army surplus store , do without it .
#Text=3 essentials of being a crusty : Politics , DIY and cheapness .
#Text=If you can construct something yourself instead of buying it , make it .
#Text=If You can come up with a clever political slogan , put it on your clothes .
#Text=Avoid leather if you can/want to , instead use vegan friendly products in constructing your look .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=A lot of people do n't like crusties , including punks , so be prepared to take the heat .
#Text=If you 're going to be a crusty , you DO NOT have to become vegetarian or vegan .
#Text=Avoid leather , wool and other animal derived clothing materials if you wish , but it 's completely your choice .
